intro: Macropeplus schwackeanus, commonly known as the Schwacke's macropeplus, is a species of plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
